page.title: 11ERSKINE POLICE STATION
page.content: Erskine Police Station was opened in 1981. Before it was built there was a detention room in the community centre for anyone caught breaking the law. The station is manned by thirteen constables and three sergeants.There is approximately eight policemen on duty at any one time. The station is open seven days a week from 9.00 am till 5.00 pm. After 5.00 pm Erskine residents are told to contact Renfrew or Paisley police stations. The police patrol the areas of Erskine, Inchinnan, Bishopton and Langbank. They have various offices in Erskine Police Station - a lost and found room, a traffic warden office, an inspector's office, a detention room and a rest room. The main work of the Erskine police is dealing with complaints and road accidents.Erskine does not have a high crime rate.
